summary: This is an email from an apparent Epstein victim/author to a long list of recipients, making wide-ranging accusations against numerous public figures, media companies, and governments for complicity in Epstein's crimes, covering up abuse, and involvement in geopolitical conflicts. It includes forwarded email chains from 2022 discussing a literary option agreement for the author's memoir, revealing tensions over contract terms and concerns about silencing.

persons.name: Steve Ross
persons.context: Appears as the literary agent for the email's author, involved in negotiating a film/TV option agreement for her memoir with producer Frida Torresblanco. Forwarded email chains show him as an intermediary.

persons.name: Frida Torresblanco
persons.context: A producer who made an offer to option the author's memoir for a series. The email chain discusses her terms and her connection to Viacom. The author accuses her of being part of a pressure campaign.

persons.name: Kathy Lombard
persons.context: Identified as the author's attorney in the 2022 email chain. She reviews and marks up the literary option agreement from Frida Torresblanco, pushing back on terms.

persons.name: Judith Curr
persons.context: Named by the author as a HarperCollins executive who pressured her to include content about the Royal Family in her memoir to boost sales and pushed her to sign with Frida Torresblanco.

persons.name: Paul Olsewski
persons.context: Mentioned by the author as the person at HarperCollins who organized all her press appearances when her book was published.

persons.name: Brian Murray
persons.context: The author states she met Brian Murray in his office with Judith Curr when her book was published.

persons.name: Benjamin Netanyahu
persons.context: Accused by the author of treason, fraud, corruption, and aiding/abetting Epstein. Also accused of war crimes and genocide in Gaza.

persons.name: Joe Biden
persons.context: Accused by the author of treason, fraud, corruption, and aiding/abetting Epstein. Also criticized for US support of Israel's actions in Gaza.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.role: Former President of the United States
persons.context: Accused by the author of treason, fraud, corruption, and aiding/abetting Epstein.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Named by the author among those who should be investigated for aiding and abetting Epstein.

persons.name: Rupert Murdoch
persons.context: Named by the author among those who should be investigated for aiding and abetting Epstein.

persons.name: Lachlan Murdoch
persons.context: Named by the author among those who should be investigated for aiding and abetting Epstein.

persons.name: Gayle King
persons.context: Accused by the author of silencing Melinda Gates in a CBS interview about Epstein. The author claims to have correspondence from King about CBS silencing Gates.

persons.name: Melinda Gates
persons.context: Accused by the author of complicity through silence regarding Epstein. The author references Gates's CBS interview about her divorce from Bill Gates due to his relationship with Epstein.

persons.name: Bill Gates
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to his divorce from Melinda Gates due to his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Elon Musk
persons.context: The author implores someone to "PLEASE TELL ELON MUSK!!!" regarding the accusations.

persons.name: Bob Iger
persons.context: Mentioned by the author as the CEO of Disney, which owns HBO. The author questions why Epstein victims are locked into HBO agreements.

persons.name: Adam McKay
persons.context: The author demands Adam McKay comment on why Epstein victims are still locked into contracts silencing them, referencing a planned HBO Epstein series.

persons.name: Julie Brown
persons.context: The author demands Julie Brown comment on why Epstein victims are still locked into contracts silencing them.

persons.name: Antonio Guterres
persons.context: The author requests the email be sent to him to invoke Article 99 of the UN Charter for a ceasefire in Gaza.

persons.name: Bezalel Smotrich
persons.context: Mentioned in linked articles about allocating funds to Israeli settlements, including illegal outposts.

persons.name: George Clooney
persons.context: Mentioned by Steve Ross in an email as having pre-empted an option for a project he intended to direct, as a comparison to the offer being discussed.

connections.description: Professional relationship negotiating a literary option agreement for the author's memoir. Ross acts as the intermediary between Torresblanco and the author/attorney.
The author states Judith Curr pressured her to sign with Frida Torresblanco due to Curr's close friendship with Torresblanco.
Colleagues at HarperCollins. The author met with both of them in Murray's office when her book was published.
Attorney-client relationship intermediary. Lombard is the author's attorney communicating with the author's agent, Steve Ross, regarding contract terms.
Former spouses. The author references Melinda Gates's divorce from Bill Gates due to his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.
Interviewer-interviewee. The author references a CBS interview where Gayle King interviewed Melinda Gates about Epstein and the divorce.
Father and son, both media executives. Named together by the author as part of the group accused of aiding Epstein.

events.title: Literary Option Negotiations
events.description: Email chain negotiations between Steve Ross (agent), Frida Torresblanco (producer), and Kathy Lombard (attorney) over an option agreement for the author's memoir. Disputes over option length (18 vs 12 months), fee, creative approval, and the risky nature of the content.

events.title: Israeli Court Approves New Settlement
events.description: Referenced via news link; an Israeli court approved a new settlement in East Jerusalem, which the author cites as part of the Netanyahu administration's plans.

events.title: Guardian Article on 'Domicide' in Gaza
events.description: The author links to a Guardian article discussing the widespread destruction of buildings in Gaza, framing it as 'domicide'.

events.title: Accusatory Email Sent
events.description: The primary email is sent, containing wide-ranging accusations against numerous individuals and governments regarding Epstein, media complicity, and war crimes in Gaza.

keyFacts: The author, an apparent Epstein victim, accuses a vast network including Netanyahu, Biden, Trump, Murdochs, HarperCollins, Viacom, CBS, and Melinda Gates of complicity in Epstein's crimes, cover-ups, and silencing victims.

Embedded 2022 emails reveal a contentious negotiation over optioning the author's memoir for TV/film, with her attorney resisting terms from producer Frida Torresblanco, who cited the content as 'too dangerous' for mainstream platforms.
The author claims HarperCollins executives (Judith Curr, Paul Olsewski) pressured her to focus her memoir on the Royal Family to increase sales, making her uncomfortable.

The author connects the Epstein case to the Israel-Gaza conflict, accusing the US and Israeli governments of war crimes, genocide, and a premeditated plan to displace Palestinians, calling for a UN ceasefire.

The author references alleged silencing efforts: CBS silencing Melinda Gates on Epstein, HBO/Disney locking Epstein victims into contracts, and the use of SLAPPs (strategic lawsuits against public participation) to silence accusers.
